an3.21:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an3.21:1.3: Then Venerable Saviṭṭha and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita went up to Venerable Sāriputta, and exchanged greetings with him.
an3.21:1.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side and Venerable Sāriputta said to Venerable Saviṭṭha,
an3.21:2.1: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, these three people are found in the world.
an3.21:2.3: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
an3.21:2.4: These are the three people found in the world.
an3.21:2.5: Of these three people, who do you believe to be the finest?”
an3.21:3.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three people are found in the world.
an3.21:3.3: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
an3.21:3.4: These are the three people found in the world.
an3.21:3.5: Of these three people, I believe the person freed by faith to be finest.
an3.21:3.7: Because this person’s faculty of faith is outstanding.”
an3.21:4.2: “Reverend Koṭṭhika, these three people are found in the world.
an3.21:4.4: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
an3.21:4.5: These are the three people found in the world.
an3.21:4.6: Of these three people, who do you believe to be the finest?”
an3.21:5.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three people are found in the world.
an3.21:5.3: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
an3.21:5.4: These are the three people found in the world.
an3.21:5.5: Of these three people, I believe the personal witness to be finest.
an3.21:5.7: Because this person’s faculty of immersion is outstanding.”
an3.21:6.2: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three people are found in the world.
an3.21:6.4: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
an3.21:6.5: These are the three people found in the world.
an3.21:6.6: Of these three people, who do you believe to be the finest?”
an3.21:7.1: “Reverend Koṭṭhika, these three people are found in the world.
an3.21:7.3: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
an3.21:7.4: These are the three people found in the world.
an3.21:7.5: Of these three people, I believe the person attained to view to be finest.
an3.21:7.7: Because this person’s faculty of wisdom is outstanding.”
an3.21:8.1: Then Sāriputta said to Saviṭṭha and Mahākoṭṭhita,
an3.21:8.2: “Each of us has spoken from the heart.
an3.21:8.3: Come, reverends, let’s go to the Buddha, and tell him about this.
an3.21:8.4: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”
an3.21:8.6: Then Sāriputta, Saviṭṭha, and Mahākoṭṭhita went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.
an3.21:8.7: Then Sāriputta told the Buddha of all they had discussed.
an3.21:9.1: “In this matter, Sāriputta, it’s not easy to definitively declare that
an3.21:9.2: one of these three people is finest.
an3.21:9.3: In some cases, a person who is freed by faith is practicing for perfection, while the personal witness and the one attained to view are once-returners or non-returners.
an3.21:10.1: In this matter, it’s not easy to definitively declare that
an3.21:10.2: one of these three people is finest.
an3.21:10.3: In some cases, a personal witness is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the one attained to view are once-returners or non-returners.
an3.21:11.1: In this matter, it’s not easy to definitively declare that
an3.21:11.2: one of these three people is finest.
an3.21:11.3: In some cases, one attained to view is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the personal witness are once-returners or non-returners.
an3.21:12.1: In this matter, it’s not easy to definitively declare that
an3.21:12.2: one of these three people is finest.”
